summary.subject: Special Issue on Innovative Frontiers in Automated Software Engineering: Call for Papers
summary.overview: This special issue invites transformative research that challenges conventional assumptions and envisions the future of automation in software engineering. It seeks contributions that go beyond incremental advances.
summary.aims_and_scope: To collect innovative ideas, visionary perspectives, and critical reflections that can reshape automated software engineering significantly. Contributions sought are beyond incremental advances and should propose new directions or insightful analyses of past research.

types_of_papers.description: Exciting new directions with initial evidence or startling results that challenge established findings.
Bold ideas backed by strong scientific intuition, exploring unexplored software engineering aspects.
Critical reassessments of past and current research directions in software engineering.

topics_of_interest: Radical approaches to automating software engineering tasks
Novel applications of automation in unsuitable contexts
Untapped potential of automation in emergent domains
Novel theoretical frameworks for software development
Examination of ethical implications in automation evolution
Reimagining correctness and verification in AI-generated software
Handling uncertainty and ambiguity in automated software engineering
Transformative applications of large language models
Radical perspectives on software composition and integration
Innovative socio-technical approaches between automation and human developers
Disruptive ideas for automated testing, verification, and validation
summary.guest_editors: To contribute, submissions should be sent to mailto:[log in to unmask]. More information is available at http://sigsoft.org/resources/seworld.html.
